title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interviews are scored on a point system.  Employees with seniority will have an advantage of points added before the interview.  Rightfully so. Depending on the manager, they will skew interviews with loaded questions, deviating from the standard questions to impede interviewees who may outshine a  pre-selected/preferred employee. Employees who sit on OHS committees or serve as union  employee rights are frowned upon; and are usually blacklisted from advancing in the organization.
Interview Questions: What do you think of specific physicians? This is a biased question. It should be illegal On interviews.

Interview Questions: A patient who is stand by assist and you where teaching crutch walking started to sway during mobilization what do you do ?

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: If you find this, please consider wasting your time applying for work here, I went to SAIT for the Unit Clerk and Medical Office Assistant program and I did my practicum at Rockyview Hospital, my whole professional experience it's been costumer service working in hospitality and other positions as clerk, I even hold a bachelor's degree. I wanted a career change. No luck? Maybe, but at this point I think it's extremely political to get in, I know someone who's working experience never was medical and got hired as manager... Consider also that AHS open positions internally and externally, I as an external candidate applied and send over 300+ resumes to AHS, and I swear to God I'm not lying, I even contacted the Unit managers directly from a directory access that I had and, hear this out, that's how I got my interviews, NO SINGLE INTERVIEW WAS FROM THE EXTERNAL WEBSITE, NONE!!!!! Also it's worth to mention that at the end of my practicum they offered me an interview, I was the last minute, last candidate, they asked me 5 questions, each question is scored and don't forget YOU ARE COMPETING AGAINST INTERNAL CANDIDATES WITH ALREADY MORE EXPERIENCE THAN YOU, if you say what they want to hear or score 4/5, more likely they'll ask you for references, then they send a whole document to your references where they score you out of 40 points and then they're supposed to make the decision to which candidate they'll go for, also each unit manager will ask you different questions some more difficult than others but at the end it leaves you wondering if you did well, you barely make a connection with the interviewer because they're not looking at you or your body language because they're writing down everything you say... So they call you and tell you that there are stronger candidates internally and that they made the decision to choose them... oh and wait... this is a MONTH AFTER you had the interview or even more! Some DON'T EVEN GET YOU BACK! I finished my practicum June 4th and it's exactly August 4th and I already gave up trying to get an opportunity to work with them. It's not to brag about it but it's their loss, happily I'm going back to a company I used to work at before because they did express and made it clear several times that they want me back, and they have offered me a position. My advice, if you have medical experience of some kind, go for it, apply,  take the course I took and apply, but if you don't, just don't waste your time and don't go to school for this to change your career.
Interview Questions:
1. Tell me about a time where you disagree with a policy/order from your employer and what did you do.
2. What qualities do you think makes a good functional working team?
3. Situational questions in a medical setting like, what would you if....
4. and similar questions...

Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions: It was good. Questions were fairly easy and was related to the position. They provided me with basic training afterwards. After the interview it took about a week to hear back on a position offer.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you came across someones name you knew in a file?

title: Human Resources Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was quite standard with lots of behavioural questions.  The bonus questions were  "tell me the first word that comes to mind when I say..."  I don't think my answers were particularly representative of me to be honest.
Interview Questions: How would one person close to you describe your communication style?

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Edmonton, AB) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and 2 days after the posting closed I was called for an interview. I arrived 15 minutes early. The interview was around 45 minutes long and was informal. I was interviewed by 2 different managers. They went over my resume and went over questions.
Interview Questions: How would you prioritize your workload?

title: Cardiology Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: 8-10 question situational and behaviour based, describe the job and the possible rotation, how many ppl may be interviewed . Do you have any questions? They ask a few basic questions about yourself and experience before starting
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a conflict with a coworkers and how did you resolve it

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Either behavioral based (tell me about a time....) or very specific to unit (how would you access X)...... Understanding of AHS culture..... With Examples from your practice.... biggest mistake and how would you approach the situation the next time....
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: IT Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Edmonton, AB) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviewers taking turns asking both technical and non-technical questions.  Everyone makes you feel comfortable and were all very accommodating.  Didn’t appear to have a strong vision of the role of IT in health care.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a complex problem that you’ve had to explain to a non-technical person.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Edmonton, AB) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: They will ask you clinical based questions so be prepared to answer questions related to the job you are applying for. Also be prepared to answer personality and behavioral based questions?
Interview Questions: If a patient has a chest tube what would your assessment look like? If a  patient was unconscious and had a pulse what would be your next steps?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel of interviewers (3), and total length took about 1 hour. They use formal interview guides (Q&A) and write down notes of how you answered. If you come from a non-health care background, be prepared to defend why you're the best candidate for the job (non clinical).
Interview Questions: There was a rapid-fire series of questions at the end, where they wanted me to respond with the first thing that came to mind - never had this happen before, it was better than I expected.

title: Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was ok. They ask about soft skills, hard skills, and situational type questions. They also look for an ideal match for their team. It is better to apply sooner than later.
Interview Questions: How good you are at managing stressful situations?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Was called for an interview which was done over the phone.  2 people were on the line both asking me questions.  Lots of scenario questions and telling them about my past experiences and why I thought I would be a good fit for the job.
Interview Questions: Medical related questions.  What would you do in this scenario ect.

title: Tester Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Edmonton, AB) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Difficult and created a lot of unnecessary steps through out the process. It seems that most areas are in relatable and may create confusion. I wish any one the best of luck going through this process
Interview Questions: What is my favourite day of the week to work?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview is offered over e-mail and (pre-covid) invited to be in person. The offer is given post-interview.  You go through their list of questions and then review certain paperwork. You are asked to provide 3 references. Expect some time (around a month) between interview and starting.
Interview Questions: How would you handle conflict (give an example).

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Set time and met with 3 people in a meeting room.  Was politely offered water and the environment was very welcoming.  There was one main person who led the interview.  She was very organized with all questions on a paper and the name of the other 2 people where it was there turn to ask a question.  They also allowed me to ask my own questions at the end.  It was a very interactive and enjoyable experience... as far as interviews go lol
Interview Questions: How has my education and experience prepared me for this role.

title: Summer Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very comfortable and felt like a conversation with the recruiter. The recruiter was very friendly and there were no trick questions asked. The recruitment process only required one round of interview, however, I received my offer after a few weeks.
Interview Questions: What is your favourite course of your degree?

title: HCA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions: First off, the lady who was doing the interview was already 20min late. I would have been okay about how late she was but she didn't  even apologize. It was a little long, but was very in depth. The other problem was that  i was not contacted either way if i got the job or not. I had left message a few days later.
Interview Questions: What was one situation that you had difficulty with, and how did you handle it?

title: Administrative Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Computer skills test followed by interview, including basic skills such as manual blood pressure readings and taking vital signs. There was a typing test, but it would be sufficient if you practiced on typingtest.com
Interview Questions: General interview questions about working with a team, dealing with difficult people and handling confidential situations.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Online Application through AHS website. In person interview with manager of the unit I was seeking employment on. The offer came by phone and then in writing within a week of interviewing.  Orientation started within a month.
Interview Questions: What does ST elevation in these ECG leads indicate?

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions: the interview is so bad because the manager already decided to hire someone before the interview. whatever your answers, you cannot pass it. the position is open for their friends, relatives and so on.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard interview questions over an hour. Interviewed by two nurses in person. It was a relaxed process. The call back took a few days and reference checks were done fairly quickly.
Interview Questions:
Why did you apply to this job? 
Case scenario question
Conflict with manager, colleague and patient...

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: There were 3-4 people that interviewed me. The interview was approximately 11 questions and it took a total of about 45 minutes. Not hard at all. The staff were very friendly. Regular interview questions.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit for this role?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed in person for 1 hour.  There were 3 people present including the Director. I was given a typing test as well as a Word Perfect skills test. The interview was very easy and comfortable. There were a few jokes made to help me feel at ease. I was offered a position but unfortunately it was NOT the job that I had interviewed for in the end.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous jobs how they relate to this current position.

title: Health Promotion Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant, but answering the questions to their standards required you to have already done exactly that job previously. Any responses showing transferrable skills or similar experiences were shut down mid-sentence. There was no follow up email or phone call so I assume I didn't get the position.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you led a team.

title: Business Continuity Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions:
A mail initiating the interview. Interview with relevant stakeholders where questions were asked about my personality and experience. After that, another mail was communicated on the success of the interview with next steps.

In general, a very well coordinated process with was very beneficial to both parties.
Interview Questions:
My experience on the job
My experience with working with people

title: Planner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB)
Interview Descriptions: Very Robust, with at least 10 questions , including how to handle conflict with team members, a time when you had a failure and what you did to overcome the challenge and  lessons learned Identification of things I liked and disliked.  Formal yet pleasant.
Interview Questions: Strengths

title: Health Research Telephone Interviewer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Very casual and comfortable via a phone interview. The phone interview was the only interview. There were no surprising questions and the interview was easy.  Basic questions about my comfort level with confidentiality, working with a variety of different people, and ability to handle conflict was asked.
Interview Questions: Asked about experience with members of the public, comfortable with sensitive confidential information, and ability to handle conflict.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB)
Interview Descriptions: It was a behavioral type interview with three interviewers. The interviewers were very pleasant and the whole process was very professional and nice. There was a written test before the interview as well
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to join AHS
What motivates you
Previous experience

title: Welcome Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Edmonton, AB) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview took about 40mins then filling out the forms took 30mins. but the coordinator was very friendly and the interview goes like a conversation between friends. questions are basic.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation you overcome

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Claresholm, AB) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Question scoring system with 2 people taking turns asking questions. I was told the interviewee with the highest score would be offered a position. The interview was approximately 1 hour in length.
Interview Questions: Mental Health suicide risk assessment, care planning and diagnosis/medication questions

title: Procurement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online and few months after I received a phone call from the hiring manager asking if i was interested in being interviewed. 
Interview is long and they follow the STAR method. Some technical questions are also asked.
Interview Questions: STAR Method questions

title: IT Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Basic personality based interview. Tell me about a time when you had this experience. And what did you do? And how did it work out? Tell me about a time when you felt stressed about you job? What did you do to relieve that stress?
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had a difficult client?

title: Therapy Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions: One hiring manager in the room with another 3 hiring managers on Skype. One booklet was general questions to get to know you, another booklet were scenario questions that were graded. Scheduled for a 1 hour time slot, but overall interview only took about 35 minutes.
Interview Questions: What do you think would be the most difficult part of this job?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Edmonton, AB) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was  a panel interview with the hiring manager, the scientific director of the organization and the scientific director of the program. I was asked to prepare a 5 min presentation on myself, the panel then rotated through asking 5-6 questions. I had a few minutes to ask my own questions.
Interview Questions: How would you approach developing an operational plan?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Search for the job on propellus, applied and submitted the application. Got an email invitation for interview and i was scheduled to have an interveiw with a coordiator. I had a one-on-one interveiw at the Peter Lougheed Centre.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Project Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted resume through their portal and the hiring person called back to arrange for an interview.

Had the hiring manager there and two senior PM's there doing the interview. Took about an hour with each of them asking questions. Mostly behavior questions.

They do require references if you are one of the candidates they are interested in and they will call them.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time where you had multiple tasks on the go, how did you manage to handle it?

title: Data Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Two rounds of interview with manager and lead.
 Included questions about behavioral,technical,past work experiences and logical thinking. Hiring process was completed in two weeks. Background check required by all means. I felt they hire people who are really willing to work.
Interview Questions: Technical and position related, and IQ questions to check the thinking level

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview process with Alberta Health Services was average to any other employer.  Skills review, one on one interview. Overall a positive experience interviewing with Alberta Health Services at the Rockyview General Hospital.
Interview Questions: Skills review

title: IT Analyst I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Edmonton, AB)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took about 3 weeks to complete. They first called me to book for an interview. The face-to-face interview involved 3 managers and me which they had asked me for various team and technical questions. The interviewers were awesome to talk to and professional as well.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with Alberta Health Services?

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions:
The first step was a Phone Screening. The interview was based on technical questions, very detailed.  The duration of the call was approximately 1 hour.
The second step was a Face to face interview. Technical and behavioural questions - The duration was 1 hour. 
I really enjoy the process, all the team involved was very professional.
Interview Questions: In depth technical questions related to the position. Oriented to the responsibilities for the job.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions: It was not that brief. They will test your nursing knowledge and critical thinking skills. They will ask scenario questions and require you to answer which would you prioritize. The manager was  nice and friendly.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you have advocated for a patient.

title: Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Interview was a standard process with two managers. They had lots of fairly common behavioral questions which can be searched on the web.  Managers took turns asking questions and were looking for someone who is flexible.  Attention to detail is important.
Interview Questions: Tell us about at time you dealt with adversity?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the Research Coordinator and the Principal Investigator. Questions were mostly behavioural and they were interested in my past experience in working independently and with minimal supervision.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you disagreed with your manager. How did you handle that situation?

title: Seasonal Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Edmonton, AB)
Interview Descriptions: Usual tedious interview consisting of so many written questionnaire and in-person with 3 HR people. It doesn't matter how good your potential is. In the end they will hire you if you know someone internally or applying from internal already, or whatever reason. Waste of time and talent.
Interview Questions: Situational and usual

title: Archives Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring was online and was quite simple. It was about six questions with an opportunity to submit both a resume and cover letter. As for the interview, it was done by two people, one of who was the supervisor and other who worked in another area of the archives. I found the interview to be quite thorough.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work here?
What kind of experience do you bring to this position?

title: Senior Program Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB)
Interview Descriptions: I received a call for an interview for the very next day. There was one individual performing the interview in the room with another person on conference call. They asked fairly stock questions and asked about salary expectations. The interview was about an hour long.
Interview Questions: Is there a type of manager that you wouldn’t work for?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Lethbridge, AB) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Did not go into much detail about the job, what a typical day would be like, etc.  Fairly typical interview, questions about strengths and weaknesses, difficult situations, managing multiple priorities, etc.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you had multiple tasks to complete and how you prioritized them.

title: Data Entry Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by phone initially to set up a date for the interview. The interview itself was about 40-ish minutes. Other people were also interviewing for the position at the same time, but with other recruiters. The questions were mostly situational/behavioural type questions asking to explain a scenario, how I handled it, and what the outcome was. There were about 8 or so questions like this. They required contact information for 2-3 references on a document which they provided and expect you have filled out.
Interview Questions: Name a situation where you had a confrontation with a coworker. How did you respond and what was the outcome?

title: Primary Care Paramedic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Slave Lake, AB) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had interview for a casual position in the Northern Alberta Zone. The interview was done in Slave Lake, but hiring was done in Grande Prairie. Interview lasted roughly 30 minutes and involved 10 mostly behavioural based questions with a scenario. Received an email about 3 weeks later stating I did not get the position
Interview Questions: tell us about a time you had a conflict with a manager or supervisor?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Edmonton, AB) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Hard and lengthy interview! I was interviewed by 3 members of my potential future team for over 2 hours. They grilled me with questions that had negative connotations. Was given feedback that they did not care for hard working people.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had a conflict with a team member.

title: Medical Laboratory Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position and was called the same day and had a quick conversation to set up a Skype interview. I was emailed information on how to set up the Skype call but was not able to get it to work so the interview was done over the phone instead. The recruiter who phoned me and the head technologist conducted the interview and it took about 45 minutes. They asked a mix of generic behavioral questions and job specific situational questions.
Interview Questions: What does reliability mean to you, and do you consider yourself a reliable person?

title: Hand Hygiene and Infection Control Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Lethbridge, AB) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by one person and then found out I had the position 1 week later. The process took about two weeks to complete with training following.  The interview was short and simple.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you are the best candidate

title: Health Care Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions:
Got a call to do a pre interview, then a week later got a call to schedule an interview, was interviewed by 2 people.
One asked the questions and the other wrote down your answers.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Administrative Support III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB)
Interview Descriptions: Required a medical terminology test consisting of 30 words. Fairly straight forward with 30 mins to complete. Once you receive a %80 of higher you move onto the next part of the interview, which consisted of basic interview questions. Scenario based and experience.
Interview Questions: What did you do in a situation when you were not agreeing with a co-worker, what did you do to fix it?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Lac La Biche, AB) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: They ask questions regarding policies, goals, values and visions of AHS. As a nurse, you are also asked scenario questions that relate to direct patient care. There is a check list of questions you will be asked. You are also asked about previous experience, education and how it relates to the job you have applied for, how to deal with conflict, how to maintain confidentiality, what you have done in the last year to contribute to health related work and what you know about AHS values.
Interview Questions: About AHS policies

title: Administrative Support III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions: A single interview with the manager and tbge team lead.  They alternated asking questions.   It was at least 2 weeks from the time posting closed until I got called for the interview.  Hired the day after, and started 1 month after that
Interview Questions: What was something you were most proud of in a past position.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Edmonton, AB) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Long Interview with 2 interviewers with questions mainly regarding how to deal with conflict and difficult people with scenarios about different patient scenarios and what you would do in the situation.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when you had to deal with a difficult client.

title: Physician (Laboratory Specialist) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions: The position posted on national specialty websites listed UAH as the hospital where the successful candidate would work. As a U of A graduate, I learned by talking to former colleagues that the description was wrong, and that the job was actually based at the Royal Alexandra Hospital. Having two years of postdoctoral fellowships, and having trained there, I thought I had a chance of at least interviewing. I called the chief of department to express my interest and she said right away my CV was rejected for lack of experience, even though they had hired several of my colleagues without additional training. The discussion was extremely unprofessional and rude, and left me relieved I did not get the job to work with this person.
Interview Questions: There were none, just thinly veiled insults at my qualifications and lies about the previously hired candidates.

title: Evaluation Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online in March. Contacted by Assistant in April to schedule interview. Interviewed in person by two researchers who were going to be working on the project. Interview was very structured and lasted 45 mins. They alternated asking questions. All the the questions were related to research and evaluation.
Interview Questions: Describe the evaluation process.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process. I applied for a different job and then was contacted and hired for this job. It was ok but not what I wanted to do.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with liturature searches?

title: Environmental Health/Housekeeping Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Peace River, AB) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: It took a while to hear back from the person doing the interviews, I had honestly  forgotten I'd applied. He was a very nice guy, but his questions were a little difficult to understand at times.
Interview Questions: If you're called at five o'clock in the morning, will you be able to come in by seven.

title: Assistant to Shift Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Edmonton, AB) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: it is a normal interview with two managerial staff members. the interview environment was very low pressure and they asked me some behavioural and technical questions relating to the job.
Interview Questions: why do you want to join this organization?

title: IT Coop Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: About thought co-op program at university. COE came to campus to interview after 2 weeks of applying. Very friendly and standard interview questions. Got a call from them to offer a position after about 2-3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Why AHS?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions:
My interview was completed
Via phone. It was with my manager and two other hr employees. It was fair, to the point, and lasted about 40 minutes in duration. They were able to answer my questions.
Interview Questions: What made you want to be a nurse

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview that took turns rapid firing questions out.  Not very personal and they mark you on how you answer your questions which I think can be pretty subjective.
Interview Questions: DIscussion of a solution I implemented that solved a problem.

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: all went well. asked relevant questions. panel interview. they called from selected resumes . prepare yourself and go for the required interview. they are really focussed in their questions. good examples
Interview Questions: process improvement based questions

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager was very transparent about how the process would work and the hiring timeline, both in the job posting and after receiving my application. My first round interview was a phone call with the hiring manager. In the second round, I talked to different people on the team. There was ample opportunity to ask everyone questions about what I should expect from the job, so I felt informed by the time I got an offer.
Interview Questions: Describe a project where you had a miscommunication with someone on the team.

title: Pharmacy Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Was contacted by phone ~a week later for an interview. Had the interview in the operation Manager's office with the manager and safety manager, and was asked the standard questions (mostly customer service oriented; next section).
Interview Questions:
- Name a time you had to deal with a difficult customer. What did you do? 

- Strengths? Weaknesses? 

Etc.

title: Instrumentation Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview started with meet and greet of the panel, then a very thorough explanation of the location layout and future plans. Other panel member explained the organisational structure. Then a number of good questions. All very casual but to the point. Very well organized interview. At the end i was able to ask questions as well.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work here?
What do you do when work is completed and no work is planned?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Calgary, AB) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: - After being selected via an online application on the AHS website, I was called and asked to come in for a panel interview with two other employees (3 interviewers in total)
Interview Questions: Name an example of conflict in the workplace and how did you resolve the situation

title: Health Care Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Red Deer, AB)
Interview Descriptions: Interview with the manager and educator review of my skills and educational background, then my aptitudes to work in a team; then asked me about the values and vision of the company and how did theyou match with my own values.
Interview Questions: What is your best quality?

title: Environmental Two Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Ponoka, AB) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The Interview went well. I was interviewed by the Cleaning manager and by the supervisor cleaner.  They both took turns &  asked me lots of questions pertaining to cleaning. I answered the best way I knew how.-
Interview Questions: If someone needed their room cleaned in a different ward than mine that I'm cleaning on & the one who's supposed to be cleaning that ward didn't do it, what would I do?

title: Paramedic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: All fairly basic questions, including some 'tell us about your background' questions, and a couple of hypothetical scenario questions, with a few 'tell us about a time...' questions. Fairly standard interview
Interview Questions: Scenario: You arrive at work and your regular partner is acting very differently. What would you do?

title: Executive Assistant Interview

title: Solution Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 10 months. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by the Director of Clinical Projects, an Enterprise Architect, and an RPN. Interview was about 1 hour long. After the Director performed the reference checks he told me that he was going to offer me the job but was waiting for the budget to be approved. After waiting 10 months I received an email that that they had hired someone internal. When I inquired as to what had happened, I was told by HR that soon after I had my interview they had put into place a hiring restraint and decided to look internally for an applicant instead. What's interesting is that when I interviewed for the position I knew at that time that a hiring restraint was in place but I was told that "as long as the job was in the hopper they could fill the position".
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses?

title: Analyst Interview

title: Graduate Nurse Initiative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Alberta Health Services (Edmonton, AB) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions:
I watched the capital health website for the Graduate Nurse Initiative (GNI) posting to go up. It is only posted for a few weeks at the beginning of February. I applied for the position online, and was phoned approximately 4.5 weeks later. At this time a date for an interview was scheduled for the following week.
I showed up for my interview, but nobody was present. I phoned the interviewer's administrative assistant - something had come up and they asked to reschedule for the following day.
When I arrived for the rescheduled interview, I was greeted by the admin. assistant and asked to wait in the patient lounge.
One of the interviewers came out to show me to her office. Two managers were present for the interview and wrote notes during the whole process. They were fairly friendly and attempted to make me feel comfortable with a little bit of small talk (the weather, traffic etc.) They both introduced themselves and described their positions a little bit. Then they asked me to some standard interview questions (why do you want to work here, what strengths/weaknesses do you bring... etc.). They asked a few scenario questions: Mr. Smith has this diagnosis, these are his symptoms. What would you do as his primary caregiver?
They asked a few safety questions (the 5 rights of med administration, insulin, delegation etc.) After this they asked me what I knew about the surgery program - what types of areas there are (eg. ortho, GI, urology, trauma...), typical acuity, type of staff (RN to LPN to NA ratio),  and which would I prefer to work in. 
After this they asked if I had any questions.
Once this was finished I was given a security clearance check form, reference check form and basic information (S.I.N., contact info, emergency contact) form to fill out. When I finished these forms I returned them to the Admin assistant and went back home.
Three weeks later I was informed that Orientation was being held on Monday (it was Friday when they phoned)

The whole process didn't seem very organized. The interview was average. My suggestion is to dress professionally (a student before me was dressed in jeans and a hoodie. She didn't get the job), ask questions, research the unit a little bit, and be friendly and confident.
The surgical units are quite fast paced and the patients can be quite heavy to look after. Most of the nurses have a lot of seniority (20+ years) so you'll be the junior for a very long time. The senior nurses are not very flexible in their thinking and you will have to change how you do some things in order to fit into the team.
Interview Questions: What are the surgical units present at this hospital?
